oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Note describing "Rebel Coffee" beans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The note by Associate Justice Thomas Jennings Bailey describes the "Rebel Coffee" as "The last rations issued to Johnston's army, May 3rd, 1865." The coffee beans were issued to Maj. Henry Heiss, who served in Co. C, 6th Tenn. (Wheeler's) Cav., CSA. He was paroled April 26, 1865 in North Carolina as Carolina as "Capt. & A. A. I. G." Postwar, Heiss became a prominent newspaper editor in Nashville and St. Louis. Heiss married Justice Bailey's aunt, Mary Lusk of Nashville.
